IeFtrbdEDjJWNrjTDHP_mA.text: Decided to try this place for breakfast as it just recently opened. I will say it really is a nice place, staff seemed very friendly and excited to be working there. Now for what's important, the food... Two of us ordered Pancakes one with a side of fruit and the third person ordered eggs over with the "bacon steak". I must say this restaurant has out done themselves. This was the first time in my life i actually needed to use a fork and knife to eat pancakes. Normally for anyone who's eaten pancakes before know they can be cut with just the fork themselves, so just wow for that point alone. What was even better was watching the table across from me eating the pancake like it was a slice of pizza, it should go with out saying, but i would not recommend the pancakes. The plus side was the Fruit was fresh! The third dinner who ordered the eggs and bacon enjoyed their meal, but did admit the bacon was too thick. They described it as thick bacon but really it's just pork belly. It was good but definitely not what one thinks of as bacon for breakfast. I was willing to come back and try lunch or dinner, but was turned off by the fact that they had CNN on the TV. If your gonna have the TV on, the local news would suffice. I don't need to be aggravated while eating my Sunday breakfast. I do wish the owners all the best, but i for one will not be back.

vldF_dxdWzJpbKwKKkFVaw.text: The service was a little slow, but it was very busy.  I had a burger that done to Perfection.    Sat outside, great visit.

DysmvfMP0tVzsbS87puIWA.text: The breakfast was great and it's nice that they are open super early in the morning.  It was a great way to get our day started.  I recommend trying their homemade English muffins.  They were really tasty with butter and jam.

Fl0c0XqQVlN1txzqF1dUTg.text: Service was pretty good. Food tasted great. It came relatively fast during a rush. The waitress was extremely attentive and well trained. I heard that this was a new, hot joint so I figured I had to check it out. For the most part, I was impressed. However, there was a woman at the hostess stand named Hannah (I think) who was extremely rude and short with us. The people at your hostess stand really set the vibe for the rest of the meal so this was extremely disappointing. Had to take away 2 stars. I'd recommend a more friendly head of house. Probably will visit again though. :/

3em0scbQA3QELFGtqlCdiw.text: I understand this is a new business and being in restaurant management myself I am extremely forgiving. Especially when it comes to the normal kinks you have when opening a new business. One thing that I can't overlook is poor customer service. A friend and I stopped in on a busy Friday night. We really liked the bar atmosphere so we headed over that way. When noticing that the bar top was full we decided to sit a one of the cocktail tables next to the bar. I approached the hostess and told her we were sitting at one of the cocktail tables next to the bar and did we need to grab our drinks from the bar or would a server we around. She informed me that there was a server that would be over. After patiently waiting about 15 minutes we started looking around with no sign of anyone coming over to wait on us. At the same time I observe 2 other drinkless tables doing the same. Finally a server walked by and one of the other guests got her attention and asked to place a drink order. She was very polite but said she was not in that area and that they didn't have a server for the cocktail tables. The guest told her that they were, like us, told their was. She said she'd send someone over but after another ten minutes no one came. I approached the hostess and again to clarify what she told me about a server being in that area. She told me "I must have misunderstood her" because they didn't have one over there. I know that I heard her correctly...as did the 3 other tables that were told the same thing.  At that point we were ready to walk out. We decided to at least stay for one drink and went up to the bar to grab one. The bartender seemed really put out when we asked for a drink menu. Then my friend asked him if there were any happy hour specials going on. I don't think that was an unusual question. He made it very clear he was annoyed by that question and acted all arrogant and made the extremely rude and inappropriate comment "this ain't TGI Friday's".  I was so taken back and appalled by his attitude! It was if he was trying to say that "upscale" restaurants would never have happy hour specials and we should have known that. Meanwhile..I've traveled the world and been to plenty of establishments that would make this "upscale" restaurant look like a casual dining restaurant...and they have had drink specials at happy hour. We didn't even care if they did or didn't...we were just inquiring if they did and were made to feel like we were fools for asking! Needless to say...we left after our drink and went somewhere else. I also observed several of the guests sitting in the cocktail area get up and leave because they were frustrated that they couldn't get a drink. Good friendly service can make or break an establishment.  I would never return to a place after being treated so rudely. It's a shame because I loved the set up of the bar and it looks like they have a great patio too! Oh well!

lOPX7qiPd8l3kpgsLMglxg.text: Nice cigar smoking bar didn't have any food went for a cigar only thing I didn't like you couldn't smoke your own cigar had to buy one there. I don't mind buying one at location since I am using your bar to smoke but let me smoke my own and buy one of yours.

IGXO6ZeK6WObiTsuNsII_w.text: So I first tried this place 2 months after they opened for brunch, everything was burnt and it took 15 minutes to make a mimosa. I refused to go back until tonight hoping they changed things for the better. However I ordered a beer that came in a 6oz glass for $8! Then my salmon that I ordered was terrible. It had no flavor at all. My total bill came to $125 which was not worth it at all. I recommend avoiding this place at all costs. Don't let the ambiance fool you into going there.

iYnH8YChfojgd9V4bN7zOQ.text: I was so excited to come here and couldn't have left any more disappointed. From the time we walked in everything was disorganized, none of the staff knew what was going on. We never got water after asking three times. The food was the worst part. Order a steak medium rare and it came out well done and tough. The quality of meat was very low. My wife's came out cold. When our server asked how it was we told them and she just said ok enjoy and walked away. I will never come back here and urge that you don't either.

-BNa6xXvCy5CWeSjIrmbtg.text: I find the best time to review a restaurant is not on their best day but how they handle the worst.  A group of us went for the crab leg special (which we have done in the past and it's great) well this time one round in they ran out of crab legs.  :(   It's not the norm and we all know sometimes things happen.  Of course we were disappointed but the management and staff held themselves completely accountable, sincere apologies, and they brought out excellent food (on them) to rectify the mistake. Sadly this kind of customer service and accountability isn't seen as often as it should in this day and age.  Well the Lot stepped up and we still had a great meal.   Now we just need to schedule another Tuesday dinner because we can't get enough of the crab legs. Haha.

sYSBlTUg8izAakCL58PwNw.text: Had dinner here with two others this weekend.  We started with soup and salad.  Very possibly the worst caesar salad I have ever eaten  It was simply terrible on every level.   The butternut squash bisque came out as more of a soup consistency and weirdly had pomegranate seeds hiding at the bottom.  It was strange and not good.   For a main course we tried the Lamb Chops and the Veal with a side of Brussel sprouts.  All three of these were done very well and we enjoyed them immensely.  The service was fair to poor as our server was not particularly attentive.   I will go back and give the steaks a shot as well as the Cigar Bar which was very crowded and very smokey (fix the air cleaners) when I took a peak.

S6ZCgimagGn0Xp6_xKnfyw.text: My family and I came to the lot for breakfast. The ambiance is the reason for the 4 rating. The food was good. They had some interesting choices on the menu. The food was not great enough for me to say that I have to go back every week. I do recommend it though.

heVuVfOit1OYCERohQ_uig.text: Let me start by stating that I have traveled the world and dined at countless places from greasy-spoon Mom & Pop's to the finest 5 Star establishments in NYC, Paris, London, Sydney, L.A., etc. and well... Pittsburgh.  I'm actually being liberal with my 2 stars because I allow for some forgiveness being that this restaurant is fairly new and probably working out some kinks.  1) Called in to check the wait time and hostess snapped at us when we asked if we could put our name in for call ahead, "I'm not going to take your name - I'll take it when you get here." (said with a REAL attitude) 2) Upon arriving was looked up and down by hostess (young lady with buzzed, short dark hair). When I asked for the wait time, again with attitude she told me 30 minutes and gave me a dirty look as if that was a long time and she wanted to turn away our business. NOT GOOD! 3) Decided to sit and dine at the bar with two friends. Our first round of drinks were just okay, but for $10 - $12 for a cocktail expectation is that they will at least taste good. Like, how do you mess up a skinny margarita with premium tequila? 4) Salad & main courses came out separately for all 3 of us. In fact, my two friends were almost done with their dinner before I got mine. 5) The Caesar salad was just plain gross. The brussels sprouts were undercooked and like eating raw with a tiny bit of char. The linguini was odd and small portion for an entree. Again, with the prices being comparable to a much finer restaurant, we expected more. 6) The braised short rib entree was delicious, but don't expect your typical shredded/pulled meat - these are actual cubed rib meat. 7) Swordfish atop risotto was also amazingly good. 8) My friend who is a huge gin drinker wanted to try a new gin, but the bartender struggled to find a list, offer suggestions and/or even bring a few bottles over. He was lost. Another clearly, more tenured bartender stepped in and made it right by finding the list and also letting us taste two different gins - of which we then ordered 2 more drinks for a nightcap.  And finally, when the bill came it was $146 for 2 of us and the bartender actually charged  $0.93 cents for "margarita mix" after already charging for the top-shelf tequila that I requested. Really??? Tacky...  All this being said, I hope the place does well and works out some of its issues, but being rude and not being welcomed with a warm smile and good attitude is inexcusable... especially in a small community like Oakmont/Verona.

HRlVloOQwVeCs9FrLu9FaA.text: Looking for something new in the Oakmont area. Found a great place with the Lot. Moderate wait but worth it. Waitress Kelly really knows her craft. The food was outstanding. Short ribs were delicious and presented very well. Salmon was also delicious. The cheese cake was spectacular. Almost a creme brulee. A great date night with the wife.

EVR4UWpJ_aESODGTeycaBA.text: Fantastic Brunch!! The standouts: Crispy Pancakes with fresh berries (AMAZING), homemade jam and whipped butter, and bacon steak. If your brunch incorporates those elements, you will leave very happy. Great service, ambiance, portion size, and value for the price. Looks like it would be fun at night with the beautiful bar.

_uv_4PHGWhP5B5bxl9ugww.text: Don't waste your money!  The steaks are poor quality and poorly prepared! Go for drinks and appetizers. My sister and I treated our father to drinks and appetizers early in the week and had such a nice experience with Elijah that we decided to do a celebratory dinner for my sister and her boyfriend on Friday night. We saw the price for the steaks and thought, wow at that price they must be amazing!  They were not!! Combination: poor quality meat and not prepared well.  Had to send two steaks back 2 times.  Unacceptable!! Ruined the entire experience. Our check was over $500.  That's a lot if money for poor quality steaks AND poorly prepared. This was supposed to be a nice celebration. We ordered cocktails and a bottle of wine m, ordered $40 steaks and 3 sides.  But we ended up arguing with the manager and my father and I sitting there while everyone finished their meal.  Soooo disappointing!  We won't be back. Absolutely NOT worth the money.

Y5Y0yBF0QxGqwUIPP0zMDA.text: So disappointed, my friends and I went for lunch this week . Our waitress was awful ! It took forever to get our order which were just sandwiches and a couple of drinks. She couldn't answer the simplest of questions about the food or drink and then ask us if we could pay so that she could leave. So we did but sat there for at least another 45 minutes and not one person approached us to see if we wanted anything or needed anything.. don't think we will be going back there!

Wv1lFOaOXzMdgY2oh-zSlg.text: I wouldn't waste a dime in this place...  We were celebrating a birthday with a party of 5, which I made reservations last week for. The way we were greeted was just the start of a complete disaster. They seated us in a booth that was meant for 4 people and added a chair at the end of the table and said sorry this is all we have because of a party in the back. Finally after complaining they moved us to the back, which I think they added tables to the waiting area bench, but at this point we are going to go with it. So, finally ordered and they bring us the worst salad I have every eaten and the steaks were over cooked and not not worth 10.00. We will definitely never return and unfortunately will not get this what was supposed to be a special Birthday dinner back. VERY DISAPPOINTED

4gKqSgryQV5nxRFK7u4Gmg.text: Its hit and miss. At various times,  I've left the Lot With feelings of great satisfaction, and other times in utter despair.  The food is usually really good. And the portions are fine.

YoSbxNU3prcozf8EDMWNMQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised !  The waiters were attentive, the food was exceptional! Lamb chops and mussels were very good and the deserts were out of this world. They had a great selection of craft beer and we stopped in upstairs in the cigar bar for an after dinner cocktail. Perfect evening!

A1bbxD40Ka1MvOBslTVYuw.text: Great breakfast/brunch spot!  Very polished and upscale feel inside, but prices for the breakfast/brunch/lunch menu were quite reasonable.  Lots of TVs - probably too many for this style of restaurant, in my opinion - but otherwise great atmosphere.  Service is excellent - our server was very friendly, attentive, and thoughtful.  She even offered us coffee to go after bringing the check!  I got the build-your-own omelette with bacon tomato and cheddar - eggs were perfectly done and bacon was diced thick and crispy.  My wife got the salmon toast and acai bowl - the salmon toast was good but had an oil drizzled on it that we felt was unnecessary.  The acai bowl was very good, with fruits and granola, made me wish I had gotten it myself.  We both had decaf coffee and it was exceptional, considering that we are both decaf drinkers who normally have a very hard time finding decent decaf in restaurants.  They seem to have a very nicely stocked bar and we're looking forward to sampling it sometime soon, along with their dinner menu.  Since this place is within walking distance from our house in Verona, I'm sure we'll be making many more trips back here.  Great addition to the Oakmont-Verona area!

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

XBk2iXQYvqh8azYHBaeUnA.text: SRUMPTUOUS  Marrow bone...roasted and served with perfect accompaniments. ..capers and arugula to balance the extreme fattiness of the delicious marrow.   Plus an equally outstanding dessert...Lemon curd with blueberry and meringue...(the name has Pavova in it)

O1yo3PJ5IQGxfm6CjfagYQ.text: My family and I went for Father's Day brunch and the food was great. Their potatoes are amazing, supposedly there is garlic in the potatoes but couldn't taste it........they did not need it. I ordered the avocado toast with a fried egg on top. Visually it was as good as it tastes, hard to eat but very good. I ended up using a knife and fork after fighting the avocado to stay under the egg. We also ordered the thin and crispy pancakes with fresh fruit and real maple syrup, very good as well. My only complaint is the wait, they seated us at 10:45 am and we didn't get our food until 11:50. Not to mention in that hour and five minutes my coffee cup was only filled twice and I had to track down the waitress both times. She was very nice and friendly but didn't pay us much attention until we started to get hangry.  Overall good and I will definitely give it another try  Update: went back a few times for dinner and it was great, I am upgrading my rating to four stars. My wife and I decided to get a bunch of small plates instead of full entrees. Really fun and extremely tasty, with a few cocktails and it wasn't as expensive as I anticipated.

FgYXKRBNoIAdl3s0oL8XMQ.text: This was a real disappointment.  Two of the four people in my party had stomach issues after our dinner.  All of our dishes were over-salted and over-dressed.  This place charges like a high-end restaurant, but (sadly) does not deliver.  Not even close.

t_l0mnvC3OC0zEclVwaS1w.text: Loved it! Egg white omelette was excellent!!!! Watch out Pamela's the pancakes are just as good and the fresh maple syrup was delicious. Also highly recommend the Bloody Mary!!!!

CKW-47KOMULcrx_Z0aGr0w.text: I visited this new establishment yesterday evening with a friend. We had already perused the menu ahead of time and thought it was perhaps a little overpriced for this market.  We were drawn to the spacious bar area and several cocktail tables available for 2-4 guests.  We asked the hostess if we could sit at the cocktail tables and be served and we were told yes.  After about 15 min. of waiting and noticing that other tables were still waiting, my friend approached the hostess again and apparently we were not going to be waited on.  Several employees and what appeared to be the roving manager/owner noticed our table as well as a few others with no beverages, menus, etc., but nothing was done to accommodate us or direct us to the bar for drinks/menus.  At this point, I was ready to leave. There were no seats available at the bar and it just set a bad tone.  I understand that new places take a while to get a feel and iron out the wrinkles, but this is basic customer service.  When I approached the bartender, I recognized him from working at two other restaurant's.  To me, this is a compliment, that I remembered him and this is his craft.  He barely acknowledged the comment and was quick to dismiss it.  I made a comment about the cocktail tables not having waitstaff and he said "we are two weeks old", as if that should affect basic organization, customer service and accurate communication to guests!  I did not feel welcomed in this place in the least.  At the very end there was one server who asked if we needed anything.  This may have happened because other guests were walking out and they finally realized that this is not good for business or repeat business!  It was too late and we decided to head to another establishment down the road.  Funny, because we saw 3 other groups at the other place because they had left The Lot.  We get the point on the trendy look, but without good service that really doesn't matter a whole lot.  I was really hoping this would be a new regular joint for me since there aren't many places of this caliber in the area.  I just left feeling hugely disappointed and will most likely not return.

cko9kmNvhY5iUlltmtEmRA.text: We are not very familiar with the area so we asked 2 locals for recommendations for lunch and along with some others, both suggested The Lot. We were so pleased with our sandwich choices. The PO Boy Lobster sandwich has huge pieces of tempura style lobster with sauteed veggies and tasty sauce. The Veggie Sandwich is perfect blend of asparagus, avocado, arugula and more on the best rye bread ever. The Reuben Pfeffer was actually house made pastrami with shredded Brussel sprouts (instead of sauerkraut ). Great tasting on the rye bread. Even the avocado toast came With a surprise egg on top. All yummy. Lots of other great choices on the menu and would definitely recommend and go back.

mc3LYak9gr1Ysx8zJ7-GCQ.text: Food is good for the most part but the service needs some work. I have sat anywhere from 10 minutes to 20 minutes just to get a waiter/waitress to acknowledge us. When the hostess sat us we weren't given a menu,  and the server finally came and asked us about drinks, we asked for a menu and when he brought the drinks, we again asked for a menu, we almost left and were going to go over to subway and bring our sandwiches back to enjoy with our drinks, when he finally brought a menu. 45 minutes till we actually had our order for food taken.

KJvmyOu0ARpw00OJMsZ75w.text: Meh. I've been here twice already for lunch, and I'm thinking I'm pretty much over it. They have a seemingly appealing menu, and they're trying really hard to be trendy and hip, but it doesn't do anything for them when the food is less than mediocre. The Caesar salad is blah. The dressing is a tasteless mixture of maybe milk, lemon and oil. The croutons taste like they've been sitting in a plastic Tupperware container for days. And then they top it off with "roasted tomatoes" which are just mushy and heavy and don't work at all on a salad. I've also had the wedge salad, which is tossed with a tasteless buttermilk dressing and tasteless prosciutto. Hey chef - add some Bleu Cheese or Gorgonzola and give that salad some flavor.   As for atmosphere, it's attractive and trendy, but they always seat us in these half-moon booths that are awkward when wanting to just sit and chat with a coworker. Also - servers are nice enough, but just really damn slow. I don't need to spend an hour and a half at your restaurant for lunch.

AofO4heNiwKDAwhjqNbk3w.text: We hit up The Lot on a Sunday Morning Early.  Like Early 8:30 am early.  There was a few people there, employees outnumbered patrons.  The space itself is pretty neat. Minimal and hipster.  There is a nice sitting area for coffee and chatting.    The breakfast and lunch menu are pretty interesting (avacado toast to egg plates) and reasonably priced.  We had a typical egg breakfast and Belgian waffles.  The egg plate was stellar and the waffles were interesting.  The flavor of the batter was great, but the texture was a little too cracker-y.  Our service was great, Elijah was on it.  Not overbearing, but personable and fun.  I want to check it out for lunch. (and smoke some cigars in the cigar bar)

skNOzt0k1S6XmUxiJ7w8jw.text: We made a reservation for Mother's Day a month in advance knowing it would fill up fast. We talked to three separate people the week before to confirm are reservation/time and all three were clueless. They at first couldn't find our reservation, even after giving our name, phone number, and time. The second time they called us and said they didn't have a table for us due to putting us on the patio and the weather called for rain and wanted to put us in the cigar bar an hour later than our original al time. Then when we got there on Mother's Day they again were confused even after telling them we got moved to the cigar bar the prior day. Management needs to practice organizational skills.

tsxcRjYSQlCXGHgdIwl2vw.text: Ate breakfast there loved it. Got the short rib hash. It was amazing. The meat was cooked to perfection melt-in-your-mouth buttery smooth power packed with flavor. The potatoes were cooked perfectly. The sauce was incredible. Got a coffee as well. Wonderful Bold Flavor. Tremendous service in the bar. Stunning atmosphere with tall ceilings and big windows. Fully loaded bar specializing in whiskey with an additional cigar bar upstairs. This place is baller. Can't wait to take everyone I know here for a night out. I'll give lunch and dinner updates soon

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Short Rib Hash. Awesome! Loved this dish. The short ribs were the best part by far.

AB9eVM4RaNRuJ2A7-c5Qag.text: Food is good! Pretty basic dinner selections and good breakfast, but too pricey!! I don't mind shelling out money for good food, but prices are ridiculous. This place is good for people who have more money than sense. There are better places with more reasonable prices in Oakmont just down the street--go there.

WkuvSTSDY10UAQTg_UU1QA.text: Amazing! If you go for dinner, order the scallops as an appetizer to share with 2-4 people. They are perfectly cooked and sit on top of butternut squash puree. Topped with pomegranate seeds and kale chips.   For vegetarians/vegans/anybody the charred cabbage and cauliflower entree is seasoned well and comes together like you wouldn't believe. I'm so glad The Lot is here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Salmon toast and açaí bowl
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Scallops with bacon jam, butternut squash purée, kale chips and pomegranate seeds. Amazing!

uTP0p6nF0Gpot74rl2K7dw.text: I've been to the Lot at Edgewater twice now, both for Saturday brunch.  The food is pretty good! Definitely an American menu with huge portions. No complaints about that here. The dining experience is really nice, and there seems to be a lot of menu options for different dietary needs. I like the atmosphere inside.  There are outside and inside seating options when the weather is right. The second time I went we were seated outside. This is not my preference as I hate outdoors and summer. It was very hot out and I asked to be closer to the air conditioner. We were invited to move to a table right next to a large open window and could feel the air conditioning more. We were already seated outside and given to a server, so I didn't want to ask to move inside and mess up their seating chart more. If they were less busy I would have.  There is a cigar bar somehow connected to the restaurant, but fortunately you cannot smell any of the smoke. I get headaches from cigar smoke (even though I like the smell), so I'm pleased with this.  I plan to come back for lunch eventually.

WzR8eEk5ol0FoS6wpArGGQ.text: What a huge disappointment...initially visited The Lot on the bar side, while waiting for a show.  Beautiful bar, great cocktails and the bartender was extremely friendly and engaging.  We couldn't wait to come back for a meal. Even excitedly shared our new find with friends.  This past weekend, we stopped by for lunch.  We were dismally greeted by a young woman that barely looked at us or spoke while she walked us to our booth. Kind of a let down, because we were excited to be back and so impressed by the beautiful dining area that had recently been decorated for the holiday.  Much to our shock, our waitress greeted us with the same cool demeanor and lack of poise or energy.    I unfortunately have to say that the food left us equally disappointed as the service.  The salad for $12 was tiny and served on a side plate, for an additional $6 I added a chicken breast that was flavorless and cold.  The $7 soup was supposed to be chilli,  it was delivered at the same time as our entrees (a huge annoyance) and was all broth...no meat or beans.  My husband ordered the Reuben that boasted house made pastrami, it was greasy and flavorless.  No cocktails ordered this time and our lunch was $49.  The entire experience was less than acceptable.  What a shame because it is open and lovely, with a beautiful industrial decor.  The other affiliated restaurants have NEVER disappointed.    Some Advice: Your staff has everything to do with delivering a good customer experience, personality and politeness are not over rated..the food is over priced for the quality and quantity that you serve.  Giving the 2 stars for the bartender and beautiful layout/decorations.

5Xn1W6O2P32AHFcHGgMc9w.text: Best breakfast I've ever had! No wait time on a Sunday morning with a party of 8! Excellent service! Amazing food! We'll be back every time we visit Pittsburgh!!!

r50u6VfpOjRhcS79alAz3g.text: Really nice space with outstanding food. I went with a buddy opening weekend and we were seated quickly and the service was fast and friendly. I got the pork chop which was as tender as you would ever hope for, and my friend got a filet which in all honesty was as good as what you'd get from a Hyde Park etc. We went upstairs afterwards and had a cigar afterwards and the selection is great as well as a great atmosphere. Really cool spot and fun experience.

AN0Qkr_2Q-8doWVIsrtBDw.text: Our family went out for a dinner last week pn a Friday. My brother had the filet my wife had the pork chop and I had the burger. When I asked the waitress how were the steaks she quoted they're awesome we're Chop House, it was we specialize in. The steak came out overdone and so did the burger. My wife's porkchop was excellent and cooked to perfection. Bar was empty on a Friday night, I don't know if that's an indicator of the pricing or just the location. All in all it's an okay restaurant and I don't really think that this will be here for a long time. FYI it's alacarte. Would I go back? Probably not. One and done.

MSubhkwjrZEXahwOsZZNIA.text: Hubs and I ate here one friday night. Just busy enough. Split the pork chop which was absolutely fantastic. Brussel sprouts were a great decision and their old fashioned's just hit the spot. Our server was attentive but not too over bearing. We will definitely be back. We prefer this restaurant over their other two sister establishments in Oakmont. Great out door seating in warmer weather!

DVbArSdk0kwM7E_xKfUbDA.text: Very cool spot for brunch, with nice outdoor seating. Close to water but not in sight. Delicious cappuccinos. I got the acai bowl, and it was very good. Boyfriend got the omelet with fresh fruit and enjoyed it as well.

DKa-OlhRPlBSKlzuwMrWQg.text: Review is based on two visits. Both experiences being for lunch. First lunch, based on the recommendation of a kitchen staff member (known to my lunch partner) and because the restaurant prides itself as a chop house, my lunch partner and I both ordered the hamburger. The burger was disappointing. Nothing special about it. The bun didn't hold up to the meat with both of us having to eat a burger with a fork, open-faced. BBQ chips came with the burger as a side. If these are made "in-house" I would be surprised. Everything about them said commercially produced.  The second lunch was a much improved experience. This time with my wife, we each ordered a different sandwich. The Roast Beef Dip and the other a BLT. I was already prepared to be underwhelmed. But ended up being pleasantly surprised by the flavor of both sandwiches. The sides still need some work. My wife order the BBQ chips, against my advice and had the same result....just OK. I had the fries and they were just OK as well. Since the sides are ordered separately and large enough for two, there really isn't any need to order two, especially if you're not going to finish them because they don't measure up.   But bottom line....as an Oakmont resident who hasn't been impressed with some of the other establishment this owner has in the area...I would say I would return and give it another try. Not sure about trying dinner yet. Seems rather expensive, unnecessarily so.

ChIImo4FCVkHf0m4dGvv1Q.text: The food and drinks here are delicious and the outdoor seating is wonderful on a sunny day. Service was also great. I think the TVs were too loud but that's my only complaint! Overall I had a great experience.

8jlLGFRIV7qVoDctRACI7A.text: Nice outside seating area. Small plates are the way to go.  Main menu is too pricey for the location.

hMqRUhsAi0GnQKNQ1Y51Yw.text: Overall, the food was amazing and drinks were superb. However, the bartenders were not very personable and they seemed like they did not want to do their job. I'm sorry but if we are spending good money, I believe we are entitled to service without laziness....

PjFK-N4aIcr32L6ptknmog.text: I got the egg white omelette with side salad, and coffee. My favorite part was that it was a  clean and  new, contemporary setting. Only reason for not 5 stars was that I believe my meal was $10-12 dollars and it was fairly tiny .  Luckily, right now I am on a lower carb diet and this worked..but if I was being my same fat self I would have been sad at the lack of food for the price.  Lol i know places have every right to charge whatever they want, but they could have given more for the money. Eggs and salad are dirt cheap. I would go back for a fancy but SMALL meal

9wUFYPf6ikqIQw3WRN1JBA.text: It's so nice to have a new dining option with healthy choices for breakfast! The menu has some unique options which made it hard to choose, so I picked 2 things.  They have a great selection of specialty toasts! I had the ricotta toast with roasted beets, oranges, arugula, pistachios and honey.  The flavor was great, but the bread was not toasted enough and got soggy real fast. I also had the acai bowl which also had great flavor, but the puree was very thin which had more of a soup like consistency.  The house made granola was exceptional.  My husband had the Kalbi steak and eggs. The portion size was small for the price, but exceptional flavor.  I cannot wait to try lunch and dinner.  The prices for dinner are on the high side, so a special occasion for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Ricotta toast
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Kalbi steak and eggs (normally served with toast, but hubby is not eating bread)
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Açaí bowl...a tad too loose

h6Q5qfzVGX188xiSRT9eDw.text: Very poor service.... does not care to attend to you when walking in... apparently the word welcoming is not in their volcabulary... also it smells like old garbage. Looks nice, but highly do not recommend even bothering going there.

lQeSNTm7JFpBsgJt-LdW4w.text: We finally got around to try this out for brunch! Our family all enjoys it, and tomorrow will be our 3rd Sunday brunch here

GTOpFGGYOEgB8rC8Z1voug.text: The Lot at Edgewater handled our baby shower luncheon perfectly! I cannot recommend them enough for any private parties. From the menu & drink planning to the attentive service from the two servers assigned to our party of ~50, from the yummy food to the way they plated the cupcakes and desserts we brought, everything was wonderful!

BWh5wKShU00n79UVGT_1uQ.text: I've been twice. It's a nice atmosphere, both inside and on the patio, but both times I wasn't a huge fan of my food. First the chicken fried steak breakfast... was okay. Biscuits oddly textured (the cheese became chewy and the dough was very dense), steak was okay, gravy meh. Second time turkey club, way too big to actually eat it in one piece so no way to get turkey, cheese, avocado, and prosciutto in one bite. At the end, had a huge pile of extra turkey left, which was a bit dry and not great. I'd prefer a lot less meat on there and maybe throw in a free side... both times my husband got the burger and was happy with it. So I guess that's the safe bet! But the chips that come with it seemed burnt and not tasty. The second time he subbed fries and they were a little better, but still very dark. Maybe they need to clean the fryer?

NhIiFE3VkgVQ_M5tmhfMCQ.text: Service is excellent. Cigar bar upstairs is awesome. Food is above average but no stand outs. Nice to have a more upscale dining option in the area.

h_WbvQQFH8tEVPuepffdnQ.text: Newly opened upscale American diner.  The decoration was chic.  We ordered shrimp cocktail it was a Jumbo size shrimps.   I ordered the iceberg salad, it was soooooo good.  The surprise element was the poppadew pepper (not sure if I spell it right) and we love it.  My fiance hate pepper and he loved those little ones.  He ordered the clam chowder, he said it was the best he ever had.    We could just be satisfied with just those 2 courses, but when the lamb chops were out, it was amazing.  It didn't taste the game from the lamb, the twice fried potatoes was a great add on the entree.  I had the braised short ribs, it was great as well.  Maybe just a tad too much fried onion, but the onion was a great on its own.     We noticed that the other reviewers didn't give this spot high review, which we were surprised since the food was very good, environment was chic, service is top notch.   We thought the food is 4.5 stars but our server Scott makes the experience to the 5.  Timing was impeccable, attentive to our drinks, follow up after a few bites, notice right away if our drinks need to refresh.  Great experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

WnTHr10Y4FNQeJtCYTSPBw.text: I wanted to give this establishment a 1 star review, but our meals were good and server Elijah was very friendly and knowledgeable on the menu. I live in the area and wanted to try out The Lot and wanted to catch up with my friend, so we made plans to meet there last night (Friday 9/21). When I got there it was pouring down raining, so I called her and she was sitting in her car as well. After waiting it out I got out and proceeded into the restaurant. My friend already made it in and was speaking with one of the ladies at the front podium. My friend informed me that we had to find our own table since people ran in from the patio and took a seat at any table. We found a small table with two chairs in the back. We sat down a waiter came over and asked did we receive menus yet, he said he will get a hostess to get us menus. A woman a little on the heavy size, floral shirt, black pants and dark hair in a ponytail came over to us asking if we had reservations. Puzzled and confused we asked did we needed to make reservations because I looked on their website a couple days ago and I did not noticed anything about reservations. She left. The waiter came over and gave us menus since he noticed she never gave them to us. The "hostess" she comes back over (by this time I was annoyed and wanted to leave). I let my friend do the talking) the "hostess" very rudely stated "next time you come in you have to wait for a hostess to sit you, you cannot just choose any table you want". My friend said that lady over there told me to pick a table since people ran in from the patio because of the rain. She left and never came back. By this time we spend 25 minutes without ordering drinks or food. My friend and I decided we were going to leave and go to Carnivores, but it was a down pour again, so we stayed.   1. Our server gave us water. It was nasty and warm. 2. We asked questions about the menu, our server Elijah was very knowledgeable on the menu and made recommendations. I ended up ordering the Lamb Chops and my friend the grilled swordfish and a side of cream greens. We both ordered drinks me a classic margarita and my friend a white sangria. (Drinks was good) 3. We waited about 45 minutes for our food. A man and woman came out with our food. Elijah seemed puzzled that he went to the kitchen and our food already went out. He checked on us a good amount of times to make sure everything was fine.  4. The food was great! My lamb was well seasoned and prepared the way I like it (med well) and my friend's swordfish was grilled to perfection. I had lamb chops in Jamaica (Sandals) and at Savoy. This was the best lamb I ever had. The portion sizes was huge. 4 nice meaty size lamb chops and about an 8oz swordfish. My friend said the cream greens was just ok, but the risotto was excellent! 5. We was never asked if the check was separated. One check came out, so I paid it since it wasn't a big deal. The total was $102.72 with tip $114.72. I think it was a little pricey for the location, but I've paid more for less lamb chops.  6. Nice decor. Chic and modern. There's a cigar bar upstairs.  7. A live band was playing and it was a nice touch.   Even though the food was good, I might never return to this establishment again due to poor customer service from the "hostess". I'm a former manager for a international top kids clothing store and customer service is everything!  It can make or break a business. Their staff needs better training on customer service or they will not be around long.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Lamb chops with greens, tomatoes, kidney beans, legume beans and a brown sauce.

iHWWl_VqfI0Thb8CcJeFuw.text: Second time in a week I came for brunch. Coffee is way better than most brunch places, they even have lots of other coffee options like lattes and other specialty coffees. The food is wonderful and they have an assortment of different options for all of the taste buds. Our server was also awesome, Jenna. She is super personable and friendly and made the overall experience more pleasurable. Most servers bring food and refill drinks but she makes sure you are well taken care of. Will be back for sure ! Def want to check out the cigar bar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

bJ8KHyk7c232izsZVpXxUQ.text: Over priced, Nicely presented food.  Draft beer list was underwhelming. Service was good, nice hostess and waitress.  Disappointed in value for the money spent. I had a very dry, smoked double-cut pork chop. Overload on the spatzel could of used more sauce. Guest had a tiny airline chicken breast with more potatoes and Brussels sprouts than anything.  Won't be back. It's a shame.... beautiful, warm restaurant.  Maybe it was an off night.

1RIWRJX6ww9QaKpdu_zGlA.text: Great brunch spot! Food, drinks, service, and ambiance were all excellent. Will definitely be back soon!

Q9TvWcQ7GfWSzU_OZ5r1OA.text: Service was great, food was fantastic. I can't wait to go back.  It's now my new favorite restaurant.

FunNIPUljyjvoREs23MecA.text: I wanted to give this place a 1 Star review over my meal, but it was just one aspect of it that I hated. Other than this one aspect, everything is really good at The Lot. The coffee was delicious, the eggs were done perfect and the potatoes on the side were seasoned real good...  Now, that one bad thing. I got the steak and eggs breakfast. The "Steak" is not real Steak, it is roast beef. The "Steak" was marinated in something (sorry don't remember what, went here a month ago now), maybe even marinated too long. I just couldn't believe that I paid Steak and egg prices for marinated roast beef and eggs.

ocrfESG2B46Yn7IYK2vLJQ.text: The Lot was not up to its standard tonight. We wanted outside seating and that didn't happen, the hostess said due to possible rain, however others were sitting out there. 2 of us ordered the Cavatappi with Crab and it was a huge disappointment. The pasta dish was an insult to the crab meat.  Dish was tasteless and cold. The pork chop and filet were excellent, however the ribeye was an over cooked, breakfast steak.  The frozen drinks of the day were excellent as were the appetizers.  Highly recommend the charred cauliflower.

qbgU5ApFNqHAQnKKmvszRQ.text: I love this place.  The food is awesome, the space is beautiful, the waiter is terrific.  I had the spinach salad with pecans and vinaigrette- they subbed goat cheese for gorgonzola for me.  The bloody mary is great.  I didn't care for the latte- it was very strong - I had to water it done a bit with cream. This is petty, but I am used to lattes having latte art on them (especially when they are $5).   The waiter with the muscles & tattoos is great. He is prompt, fast, accurate, accommodating, patient. We actually had the same waiter last time I was here in the summer and remember him because he is terrific.   Now the manager is another story. The lady who made our reservation specifically mentioned our group would "be there for a while" and was told that would not be a problem at all. Otherwise she would have picked another spot. Well, after 2 hours, the manager came over and asked us to leave. We were still ordering drinks & food, so it wasn't like we were monopolizing a table and sipping water. Our waiter was super cool about it. But the manager kept glaring at us. Then she had to set up another table for another large group (there was tons of room) and she was huffing & puffing & glaring. We stayed 3 hours. Now, I understand it was a Sunday, a very busy time for them. However, the way this was handled was classless & disgraceful. If there was a 2 hour time slot, she should have informed us when seated. Then we could have chosen to leave and go elsewhere or not at that time. There is a graceful way to handle getting customers to wrap up, and huffing, puffing, glaring is not graceful. As we were leaving, and walked by us, she said "oh finally! We get rid of them!" - um - we can hear you! And, she whirled around and stormed to the table and slammed right into me! She murmured a snarly "sorry" and stormed away. Everyone in my group was stunned! That was completely uncalled for!   Despite this, I still say I love this place, would recommend it, and would return. I wouldn't let one person's bad behavior change my opinion.

-Rl_2chUZxsELEO3jVR4vQ.text: This place seriously has the best BLT ever. Good mimosas too. Beer selection is good as well.

wIaOlLc5LYmb7C7p9IfETA.text: The atmosphere is awesome and the bartender was very talkative and attentive. Very nice bar area and decor throughout. I ordered the center cut ribeye and garlic mashed potatoes.   Let me tell you, you get what you pay for. The ribeye steak was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor (20oz). Potatoes were perfectly seasoned, whipped, and served in a large portion.   I would definitely recommend this establishment.

646IBCbaxEmBCviUxlT6Yw.text: Love this place ! I must say I'm a regular oakmont diner and I absolutely fell in love . The food was amazing (scallops, mussels, calamari, Brussels , etc) out of this world ! Our server , Elijah, was super helpful with my questions and very attentive . We sat on the patio so the atmosphere was nice and calming . The manager made a point to pop out and say hello which was great , thanks Molly! We finished the night in the cigar room with some dessert and the bartender was extremely knowledge about which wines or cigars we should try . Love this place , will be back !

0OnSF2QqydNLQS5zEq_IAw.text: Food was way over priced for what we got. They are in Oakmont pa so I believe the logic is people will pay a fortune for crappy food and crappy service, right?

pvdoF3EECERa6x_73ZA0Rg.text: Love the cigar bar!   I compare this to several nice, upscale cigar bars I have been to.  The servers are awesome.   Great bourbon and cigar selection!   I don't eat while here so can't rate the food (Although I have had risotto and peas - both were good).

yKfLFTXFiTmK1YfzgLUxpw.text: Yum! The Lot feels nicely tucked away from the busyness of other areas in Oakmont but still full of life with a great ambiance. I went there on a Monday night for a work dinner and was blown away by the great food. I got the gnocchi bolognese. The ragu tasted so good on top of the soft gnocchi. It was a pretty good portion too- I was able to take half home for lunch the next day! Finished with the beneigts which were more like donuts (in terms of shape) but so tasty. I would recommend splitting them, it's a pretty large portion.   The prices fall in line with a "nice" restaurant but are still up there for an everyday meal. Our server was nice but service from him was slow and he would forget some things. In general I would return for a nice occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Gnocchi

T2rbJhl0AVp7U2sBUiZQvw.text: This review focuses on their 2019 restaurant week menu as that is our only experience (though based on it, it likely will maintain our only experience). The crab/pasta entree was significantly lacking in flavor and didn't match the description on the menu (forgetting chili flakes and adding asparagus) and, while flavorful, 2 small scallops doesn't make an entree.  The peach "cobbler" was also clearly just canned peaches with a crumble on top.  An unfortunate meal for a restaurant we have been excited to try.   To add on, at no point did anyone on staff ask if we were enjoying our meal ... pretty sure they knew that their restaurant week menu wasn't up to par. While other people's steaks looked nice, not sure if we can trust a second chance after such a poor first impression.

vOzkI-8d3-kWmK4K34uKDg.text: We went for a late breakfast on Saturday morning. Walked in through the patio, which had lots of open tables, and decided we would like to sit out there. Went inside (which also wasn't crowded) and lined up behind two other parties at the hostess desk. The young man there asked us if we had a reservation. No - for breakfast? In Oakmont? OK, there's not many folks here, so they should  be able to seat us soon, especially outside. "There's one party ahead of you, so we should be able to seat you in about 20 minutes." This made no sense, and we almost left then, for one of the other nearby eateries where no reservation is required for a casual breakfast. Oh if only we had! The young man wrote our name down on the last available sliver of a Post-It note, then disappeared. About 20 minutes later, a young woman said our table ready, and lead us to a table, inside, beside the bar. My wife looked at me, & I said to her "Don't fight it". We took the table offered, while the patio remained largely vacant. We ordered omelettes, and waited bit longer than I would have preferred for our food to arrive. Our plates were delivered by someone from the kitchen, and mine was missing a side I had ordered.  My omelette was OK, a bit small, with good potatoes. My wife's egg white omelette was reportedly not good. It came with a side of greens that were obviously old, as were the side of mixed berries she ordered. Largely inedible. I'll try to post a pic. Gnats soon found the berries and loved them.  We were severely disappointed and won't be going back. If you're going to request reservations, have something worth coming in for. And get my table request right.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Wilted greens and old berries.
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Bar

PkGS2NRd1MeZRORgu6wTxQ.text: OK.  I have been coming here for breakfast since February of this year (2019) and in the beginning things were great.  One of the best breakfasts around at that time.  But now since they have lost their husband and wife chef team, things are in a state of flux.  The omelettes, which were fluffy and yellow are now flat and browned from the butter.  The toast is toasted on the edges only, the sausage keeps shrinking, the a la carte order of bacon is shrinking and the potatoes....let me tell you about the potatoes!!!!!!!  They started out as twice cooked potatoes, some smashed some almost intact, firm, sweet interior and an exterior that WAS out of this world.  The secret?  They were second cooked in bacon fat and butter.  They were heaven.   But what happened????? They caved...They CAVED big time.  To whom, you ask?  To a MINORITY and a scourge to restaurants known as vegetarians.  This is a Chop House, a Carnivour Palace...hell, another restaurant they own is called Carnivores.  The wittle bunnies didum wannum eatum does nasty potatoes wiff dat nasty wasty  animal fat on dem. Why would you bend over for vegetarians?  They are now prepared with Extra virgin olive oil and garlic.  They are mediocre at best. The pancakes, which were always a rip off of Pamela's were still good.  I ordered a stack recently and I COULD NOT CUT THEM WITH A KNIFE AND FORK.  The server offered to get me new pancakes but I wasn't a glutton for punishment that day and couldn't take another disappointment.  However!!!!!  There is still a shining light among the poorly prepared food and that is the Wait Staff.  I return because they are the best...the absolute best.  Friendly, accurate, efficient, and yes, caring.  They want your experience to be a positive one.  People like Jake, MJ and Sarah are the best that I have had the pleasure to know in a long time.  Why are you caving?  Why aren't you sticking to your original vision?  Now is the time to stick by your guns.  If they don't like the potatoes then keep some boiled spuds on the side for those wimps.

S3eoyDKhBd06QgwUGnjm1w.text: A solid spot in Oakmont. The restaurant space is huge and it's very nice, clean and modern. They have a large patio area as well. It was pretty busy today and the service wasn't so great. They have a decent breakfast and lunch menu, they serve both till 3:30. I hear dinner is much pricier. The sandwich I had was fantastic with a lot of great flavors. I added fries (because the sandwich didn't come with anything) and I wished I hadn't because the sandwich was so big I really didn't need anything else. The fries were okay. Would definitely recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Roast Turkey Club

86oaJbZik9i96S7IvNjhCQ.text: I went here in all you can eat crab legs night. We were unable to sit outside even though there were seats do we parked at the bar. We ordered a few different apps And drinks. The service was so slow and there was only one bartender for the entire bar and restaurant. If this is such a busy night there should have been more help

o1CMCK7SCt7CMwbAnWDn9g.text: Breakfast almost all day! Amazing! Great spot, location and ambiance. Wonderful avo toast.

NEr_O4KSTuaz6Tbp0beU3A.text: I didn't realize this was a newer place, I figured I'd just never heard of it before as I'm not often in the Oakmont area.  But I'm glad I found it thanks to a yelp nearby search after a morning hike.  I walked in and was immediately seated.  I got there a little on the early side for brunch and stayed for about an hour so it was busier when I left.  The menu offers a variety of options.  I went with the egg white omelet that came with a side salad.  My server commented that I was going healthy today but I told her I wasn't done.  I also ordered a side of bacon.  And then went back to healthy with a side of mixed berries.  They have a nice looking coffee and cocktail menu but I just went with water and regular coffee.    The interior is very open and bright, especially on the sunny day I was there.  The tables are cozy so you might want to settle in for a bit.  There was not a long wait for my food and I thought the prices were reasonable even though it felt a bit more upscale.  Highly recommended for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. egg white omelet, side of bacon, side of berries, coffee

9_yXtQyEdkLFV47QyaQv7g.text: Bar/Drink Review Only:   We stopped in here after a long day of work. I had never been before and I must say I was very impressed.  Ambiance/Decor: Great, has a classy feel and it felt perfect for a place to kick back and have some great conversations and a relaxing time. Great bar space, but tables with booths as well. There is also a fire pit on the patio that people were sitting at and a cigar bar upstairs (you would have no idea other than the sign because you can't smell it downstairs).  Bar: We took seats at the bar since we were only having some cocktails. I had the Edgewater Old Fashioned which turned out to be really good. I was also happy to see that they are keeping the cocktails classy but almost all are under $10, which is a great find. Our bartender was incredibly attentive and helpful. I did not catch his name but he was a solid bartender even though the bar was full. Also, turned out on a Thursday, they have live jazz and the band was really good. People got up to dance a little too. There are TVs at the bar too if you just want to kick back, enjoy quality service and watch a game.   I did not try any of the food but I am picky about my drinks so for that experience alone, I kept it at a five star because service, cocktail, price point and music were all on point.   I noticed they do have happy hours and I may be back for all you can eat crab legs on a Tuesday night.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

rokJ6O4LTdNJcW-NtS2Low.text: The place was crowded but the servers did a great job with getting us seated. The food was delicious! Everything was hot. The potatoes weren't seasoned and the breakfast is a tad overpriced for what you get. Overall, it's a place that I'd visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. BYO omelette. Fried red potatoes.

PhyhiZSELc7fARKhB3pQYw.text: Service terrible, had a sticky table that stayed sticky after telling the server.  Had to hunt for crab in a Restaurant Week crab dish.  Poor example of what should be an elegant area.

HQKtjsRw7tCpYWIjVHaMhg.text: I have been to this restaurant over a dozen times since the opening.   The food is usually very good but not always consistent.   The servers are always amazing but the management needs to learn some people skills.  Out last trip for brunch, included several out of  towners and while still eating and drinking and ordering food our server was instructed to give us our checks.  Then the manager came over telling or asking us to pay our checks.    We of course did not and proceeded to be subjected to management actually cursing and pretending to be subtle with their hostility.   ( I could go into actually physical hostility they exhibited, but won't) When paying these prices with tip (20%) already calculated in for us, I don't feel the need to please management's urgency for us to hustle.  They need more experienced leadership.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Almost as good as Pamela&#39;s pancakes.
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Very dry mimosa

_y4RP_XI7yQA2XkEKqW4pQ.text: I was here with my lady friends snd we done once a month at a restaurant that is new to us.  We had a very good experience with everything from burgers to short ribs to tuna poke, the tuna poke was more of a tuna tartar, but it was very good, fresh and looked as good as it tasted.  Lots of options and a nice atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Fish
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Beef short ribs

P7Hco3ggtUJa4IRqt7AhJw.text: WOW!  Every detail is considered.  The food is amazing.  The Executive Chef and Manager, Jeff and Molly are creative and talented.  The Salmon toast is heavenly.  We came for Sunday Brunch ... just look at this Bloody Mary Bar.  The Lot is elegant casual. Such a delicious treat.  Hurry in ... you will be delighted.  After dining stroll the area, it's  charming and quaint

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

uaJsmPF6Lo0rY3UaERpT4A.text: The Lot is a solid place to eat! I've eaten there for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and each time had excellent meals! They're super conscientious about letting you know what's in their food, so if you have a food allergy, this is a great place to go. Also, they have veggie options and great meat options. The service isn't always great, but the food is amazing! I recommend their avocado toast, the shrimp tacos, the scallops, and their Cabbage and Cauliflower dish. My husband likes their burgers. You can't go wrong with The Lot!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Redskin smashed potatoes
Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States. Shrimp tacos

o3Ky1rUPrMkSr8ZLiZT03Q.text: Went to the lot for breakfast on Saturday morning. Eat outside. Priced very reasonable. Good portions. Great service. This is the best breakfast place around. Unique meal choices. Lunch and dinner menus look good. Full bar also wine bar and cigar bar(separate). Worth a try.

MC6vTMPrVnre_MzcAcpKiA.text: Truly one of the best meals we have had in some time. We ordered salads and sides, then split the insanely delicious pesto burrata pasta. Our waiter was knowledgeable and entertaining, without being overbearing. We loved the ambiance and believe this will be the new go-to in oakmont! It was loud enough that our young daughter did not disturb other diners, but intimate enough for a date night. Highly recommend! Make sure you order the Brussels sprouts- perfectly prepared. Meal was slightly pricey ($80ish I think) but portions were quite generous and quality was high, so it was worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of The Lot at Edgewater - Oakmont, PA, United States

UNbB64d3PVM-87ztOxmirw.text: This place was really nice. I was a first timer there and my friend and I went for brunch. My omelette was good and we also split a waffle to try. I don't really have any complaints, other than the previous patrons bill was left at our table the entire time we ate ... weird. Other than that the feel was different. A little more industrial style which I liked. It was not busy and I would go again if the option arose!

fL7xf0aQCdBtAIU0rvnoyA.text: I ordered a medium burger and when I got it, it was well done and the fry's were completely under cooked. Now that that is done since it wasn't edible I ended up going to Chick-fil-a.

R1fXlgN5WQ2xs8rGx4jVGQ.text: The service is awful!  It started with the hostess and didn't get any better.  If you have nothing else better  to do with your life, then spend the day there for lunch.  Food isn't that great the bread on the Rueben was sopped in butter.  It took forever to get our food.
